  C: 25
  D: 40
  E: 52

The sales person gets a 10% commission on each sale, and the sale price is $250.
To calculate the number of sales the sales person needs to make to reach a salary of at least $1000, I will use the following formula:
Commission = Commission percentage x Sale price
Commission = 0.10 x $250
Commission = $25

To find the number of sales the sales person needs to make, I will divide the desired salary by the commission per sale:
Number of sales = Desired salary / Commission per sale
